justification: The article introduces the "wisdom-of-crowd indicator WoC(x, θ)" and describes it as a metric that "quantify[ies] the degree of crowd wisdom," indicating it is used to measure the construct of crowd wisdom.

The text states that "The fraction of outperformed estimates FoE(x, θ, colD) … reflects the probability that the collective decision is better than a decision made by choosing a random estimate," presenting it as another measure for assessing crowd wisdom.
